New Records: Josh Hart became the first Knicks player since Michael Ray Richardson in 1981 with consecutive triple-doubles.
Key Match Events: Karl-Anthony Towns had 31 points and 21 rebounds
Josh Hart recorded a triple-double with 15 points, 14 rebounds, and 12 assists
Jordan Clarkson and Collin Sexton each scored 25 points for the Jazz
Deuce McBride developed left hamstring tightness during warmups, leading to Cam Payne being inserted into the starting lineup
Post-Match Reflections: The Knicks have won 14 of their last 16 games
The Jazz lost their fifth straight game
